title: What is the stance of the author on the criticisms against the practice of magnetism and its potential benefits in medicine?
first_phrase: In this text, the author defends the validity of magnetism against detractors. The author refutes common criticisms of magnetism without supporting evidence and challenges the reader to analyze their observations. The fear of the progress in pathology and therapeutic obtained with magnetism is the underlying reason for the opposition to this branch of science. The author emphasizes the importance of facts and personal observation in forming convictions about magnetism. The text mentions Alais, Alusset, AI. Castel, D1' Husson, and Hostau.
content: Castel, dans la séance do F Académie du 28 juin 1830, émettait déjà cette crainte puérile, quand il répondait au D1' Husson : « Je n’accepte pas de pareils phénomènes; car c’est l’annihilation de la moitié des connaissances physiologiques ». C’est donc la mémo pensée qui guide encore nos détracteurs et non la sincère conviction do la fausseté de nos idées en magnétisme. 10 octobre N° 1? Lisez nos observations ; analysez-les ; démontrez que rien n’y est vrai ; que tout y est fantaisie et alors je m’inclinerai. Mais jusque-là, vous mo permettrez do défendre mes convictions acquises, autant que faire est possible. Car ce que j’ai vu, je l’ai bien vu et comme a dit Hostau (1) : « On ne me fera pas dire le contraire; tous les faits négatifs ne peuvent détruire un fait positif.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the defenders of magnetism have been advocating for the existence of an unknown force that could revolutionize medicine for over a century. Despite facing criticism and skepticism, they stand firm in their convictions and challenge their opponents to analyze and refute their observations. As with any scientific pursuit, an open-minded and evidence-based approach is key to understanding and accepting new ideas.
